frostypy package¶

Submodules¶

frostypy.core module¶

  • Dimensionless Numbers
  • Dimensions

Dimensionless Numbers¶

frostypy.core.Fourier(alpha_a, t, L)¶

Calculates the Fourier number

..math::
(a + b)^2 = a^2 + 2ab + b^2
alpha_a : float
Thermal Diffusivity [m^2/s]
t : float
Time [s]
L : float
plate length [m]

Fo : Fourier number [-]

>>>

..[1] (insert here)

frostypy.core.Hatta(x_s, lamb, t, epsilon, D)¶

Calculates the Hatta number ..math:

\rho_f = 207*exp(0.266*T_f - 0.0615*T_w)
x_s : float
Frost thickness (m)
lamb : float
Desublimation Coefficient (1/s)
t : float
Time (s)
epsilon : float
Porosity (-)
D : float
Diffusivity of water vapor in air (m^2/s)

Ha : Hatta number (-)

>>>

..[1] (insert here)

frostypy.core.Jakob(cp, i_sv, Tsat_a, T_w, omega_a, omega_sat_w)¶

Calculates the Jakob number

..math::
lambda = frac(Cp/isv) * (Tsat_a - T_w)/(omega_a - omega_sat_w)
i_sv : float
Latent heat of sublimation [J/kg]
Cp : float
Specific heat of dry air [J/kg*K]
Tsat_a : float
Saturation temperature of air [C]
T_w : float
Plate surface temperature [C]
omega_a : float
Humidity Ratio [kg_vapor/kg_total]
omega_sat_w : float
Humidity ratio @ Tsat

rho : Density of frost (kg/m^3)

>>>

..[1] (insert here)

frostypy.core.Lewis(D, alpha)¶

Calculates the Lewis number ..math:

Le = D / alpha
D : float
Diffusion coefficient of water-vapor in the air (m^2/s)
alpha : float
Thermal diffusivity of air (m^2/s)

Ha : Hatta number (-)

>>>

..[1] (insert here)

frostypy.core.Nusselt(h, L, k_a)¶

Calculates the Nusselt number ..math:

Nu = h * L / k_a
h : float
Heat transfer coefficient [W/m^2*s]
L : float
Plate length [m]
k_a : float
Thermal conductivity of Air [W/mK]

Nu : Nusselt number (-)

>>>

..[1] (insert here)

frostypy.core.Reynolds(V, L, nu)¶

Calculates the Reynolds number ..math:

Re = V*L/nu
V : float
Air Velocity [m/s]
L : float
Plate length [m]
nu : float
Dynamic Viscosity [m^2/s]

Re : Reynolds number (-)

>>>

..[1] (insert here)

frostypy.core.Sherwood(h_m, L, rho_a, D_a)¶

Calculates the Sherwood number ..math:

Sh = h_m * L / rho_a * D_a
h_m : float
Mass transfer coefficient [kg/m^2*s]
L : float
Plate length [m]
rho_a : float
Density of Air [kg/m^3]
D_a : float
Mass Diffusionn Coefficient [m^2/s]

Sh : Sherwood number (-)

>>>

Calculates the Sherwood number ..math:

Sh : Sherwood number (-)

..[1] (insert here)

frostypy.density module¶

  • Density Correlations

Density Correlations¶

frostypy.density.Hayashi(Tf)¶

Calculates the frost density, rho_f, according to the Hayashi correlation (1977) for a flat plate, which is valid for:

-15 <= Tw <= -5 [C], 16 <= Ta <= 22 [C], 0.5 <= psi <= 0.8 [-],

u_a = 0.7 [m/s]
..math::
rho_f = 207*exp(0.266*T_f - 0.0615*T_w)
Tf : float
Frost surface temperature [C]

rho_f : Frost density (kg/m**3)

>>>

..[1] Hayashi, Y., Aoki, A., Hori, K., 1977. Study of frost properties correlating with frost formation types. J. Heat Transfer 99, 239-245.

frostypy.density.modified_Hayashi(Tf, Tw)¶

Calculates the frost density, rho_f, according to the modified Hayashi correlation () for a flat plate, which is valid for:

-15 <= Tw <= -5 [C], 16 <= Ta <= 22 [C], 0.5 <= psi <= 0.8 [-],

u_a = 0.7 [m/s]
..math::
rho_f = 207*exp(0.266*T_f - 0.0615*T_w)
Tf : float
Frost surface temperature [C]
Tw : float
Plate surface temperature [C]

rho : Frost density (kg/m**3)

>>>

..[1] (insert here)

frostypy.density.Hermes_2009(lamb, t)¶

Calculates the density of frost according to the Hermes correlation for a flat plate, which is valid for:

-15 < Tw < -5 [C], 16 < Ta < 22 [C], 0.5 < psi < 0.8 [-], u_a = 0.7 [m/s]
..math::
rho_f = 207*exp(0.266*T_f - 0.0615*T_w)
lamb : float
modified Jakob number [-]
t : float
time [s]

rho : Density of frost (kg/m**3)

>>>

..[1] Hermes, C.J.L., Piucco, R.O., Melo, C., Barbosa Jr., J.R., 2009. A study of frost growth and densification on flat surfaces. Exp. Therm. Fluid Sci. 33, 371-379.

frostypy.density.Hermes_2014(Cp, Tsata, Tw, hsub, wa, wsatw, t)¶

Calculates the density of frost according to the Hermes correlation for a flat plate, which is valid for:

-15 < Tw < -5 [C], 16 < Ta < 22 [C], 0.05 < psi < 0.8 [%], 0 < t < 120 [min] u_a = 0.7 [m/s]
..math::
rho_f = 2.2 * ((Cp*(Tsata - Tw)) / (hsub*(wa - wsatw)))**-1.5* t**0.5
Cp : float
Specific Heat [J/kg*K]
Tsata : float
Saturation Temperature of Air [K]

Tw : float

hsub : float

wa : float
Relative Humidity of air [%]
wsatw : float
[%]
t : float
time [s]

rho : Frost density [kg/m**3]

>>>

..[1] Hermes, C. A semi-empirical correlation for the frost density

frostypy.density.Hosoda(Tw, Va)¶

Calculates the frost density according to the Hosoda and Uzuhashi correlation for a flat plate, which is valid for:

-15 < Tw < -5 [C],
..math::
rho_f = 340*|Tw|**-0.445 + 85*Va
Va : float
Air Velocity [m/s]
Tw : float
Plate surface temperature [C]

rho_f : Frost density [kg/m**3]

>>>

..[1] Hosoda T, Uzuhashi H. Effects of frost on the heat transfer coefficient. Hitachi Reivew 1967;16(6):254-9.

frostypy.density.Kandula(rho_i, Tf, Tw, Tm, Re, Rec)¶

Calculates frost density according to the Kandula correlation (2012) for a flat plate, which is valid for:

-20 < Tw < -5 [C], 10 < Ta < 22 [C], 0.7 < v < 2.5 [m/s], 50 < RH < 80 [%]
..math::
rho_f = (rho_i * (0.5*((Tf-Tw)/(Tm-Tw))
  • numpy.exp(-(0.375+1.5*((Tf-Tw)/(Tm-Tw))))
  • (1 - numpy.sqrt(Re/Rec))) )
rho_i : float
Ice Density [kg/m^3]
Tf : float
Temperature of frost [K]
Tw : float
Temperature of vapor [K]
Tm : float
Temperature of [K]
Re : float
Reynolds number [-]
Rec : float
Critical Reynolds number [-]

rho_f : Frost density [kg/m^3]

>>>

..[1] Kandula, M., 2011. Correlation of water frost porosity in laminar flow over flat surfaces. Special Top. Rev. Porous Media - Int. J. 3, 79-87

frostypy.density.Leoni(Re, Ja, ww, wa, t)¶

Calculates the density of frost according to the Leoni et. al (2020) correlation for a flat plate, which is valid for: ???

-35 < Tw < -15 [C], -5 < Ta < 15 [C], 1.0 < v < 2.5 [m/s] 0.00322 < w < 0.00847 [kg_v/kg_a]
..math::
rho_f = 5.47*Re**0.16 * Ja**0.29 * (ww/wa)**0.61 * t**0.34
Re : float
Reynolds number [-]
Ja : float
Jakob number [-]
ww : float
Relative Humidity of [%]
wa : float
Relative Humidity of air [%]
t : float
Time [s]

rho : Frost density [kg/m^3]

>>>

..[1] (insert here)

frostypy.density.Mao(Re)¶

Calculates the frost density, rho_f, according to the Mao et. al (1992) correlation for a flat plate, which is valid for:

-15 < Tw < -15 [C], 15 < Ta < 23 [C], 1.15 < v < 2.67 [m/s]

..math:

Re : float
Reynolds number [-]
Ja : float
Jakob number [-]
ww : float
Relative Humidity of [%]
wa : float
Relative Humidity of air [%]
t : float
Time [s]

rho_f : Frost density [kg/m^3]

>>>

..[1] Mao, Y., Besant, R.W., Rezkallah, K.S., 1992. Measurement and correlations of frost properties with airflow over a flat plate. ASHRAE Trans. 98, 65-77.

frostypy.density.Sommers(lamb, sigma, RH, t)¶

Calculates the density of frost according to the Sommers et al. correlation for a flat plate, which is valid for:

-15 < Tw < -5 [C], 16 < Ta < 22 [C], 0.5 < psi < 0.8 [-], u_a = 0.7 [m/s]
..math::
rho_f = (2.16*lamb**(-3/2) * t**0.5 * (45/numpy.log(sigma))**0.95 * (0.8/RH)**0.60)
lamb : float
modified Jakob number [-]
sigma : float
Contact Angle [degrees]
RH : float
relative humidity [%]
t : float
time [s]

rho : Frost density (kg/m**3)

>>>

..[1] (insert here)

frostypy.density.Yang(rho_i, Re, Fo, wa, Ta, Ttp, Tw)¶

Calculates the density of frost according to the Yang and Lee correlation for a flat plate, which is valid for:

-35 < Tw < -15 [C], -5 < Ta < 15 [C], 1.0 < v < 2.5 [m/s], 0.00322 < w < 0.00847 [kg_v/kg_a]
..math::
rho_f = 2.2 * ((Cp*(Tsata - Tw)) / (hsub*(wa - wsatw)))**-1.5* t**0.5
rho_i : float
Ice Density [kg/m^3]
Re : float
Reynolds number [-]
Fo : float
Fourier number [-]
wa : float
Relative Humidity of air [%]
Ta : float
Temperature of air [K]
Ttp : float
Triple-point of water
Tw : float
Temperature of vapor [K]

rho : Frost density [kg/m**3]

>>>

..[1] Yang, D.-K., Lee, K-S., 2004. Dimensionless correlations of frost properties on a cold plate. Int J. Refrigeration 27 (1), 89-96.

frostypy.density.Hayashi(Tf)

Calculates the frost density, rho_f, according to the Hayashi correlation (1977) for a flat plate, which is valid for:

-15 <= Tw <= -5 [C], 16 <= Ta <= 22 [C], 0.5 <= psi <= 0.8 [-],

u_a = 0.7 [m/s]
..math::
rho_f = 207*exp(0.266*T_f - 0.0615*T_w)
Tf : float
Frost surface temperature [C]

rho_f : Frost density (kg/m**3)

>>>

..[1] Hayashi, Y., Aoki, A., Hori, K., 1977. Study of frost properties correlating with frost formation types. J. Heat Transfer 99, 239-245.

frostypy.density.modified_Hayashi(Tf, Tw)

Calculates the frost density, rho_f, according to the modified Hayashi correlation () for a flat plate, which is valid for:

-15 <= Tw <= -5 [C], 16 <= Ta <= 22 [C], 0.5 <= psi <= 0.8 [-],

u_a = 0.7 [m/s]
..math::

frostypy.density.Hermes_2014(Cp, Tsata, Tw, hsub, wa, wsatw, t)

Calculates the density of frost according to the Hermes correlation for a flat plate, which is valid for:

-15 < Tw < -5 [C], 16 < Ta < 22 [C], 0.05 < psi < 0.8 [%], 0 < t < 120 [min] u_a = 0.7 [m/s]

Calculates frost density according to the Kandula correlation (2012) for a flat plate, which is valid for:

  • numpy.exp(-(0.375+1.5*((Tf-Tw)/(Tm-Tw))))
  • (1 - numpy.sqrt(Re/Rec))) )

Ice Density [kg/m^3]

Calculates the density of frost according to the Yang and Lee correlation for a flat plate, which is valid for:

frostypy.porosity module¶

  • Porosity

Porosity¶

frostypy.porosity.Hermes(rho_f, rho_i, rho_a)¶

Calculates the frost thickness according to the Cremers & Mehra correlation for a tube, which is valid for:

Ta = 24 [C] Free convection 9.2 < w < 15 [g/kg_a], 45 < psi < 90 [%],
..math::
y_f = 0.20*t*(Tf - Tp)**0.4
Tf : float
Frost Temperature [K]
Tp : float
Cold Plate Surface [K]
t : float
time [s]

y_f : Frost Thickness [m]

>>>

..[1] (insert here)

frostypy.porosity.Hermes(rho_f, rho_i, rho_a)

Calculates the frost thickness according to the Cremers & Mehra correlation for a tube, which is valid for:

Ta = 24 [C] Free convection 9.2 < w < 15 [g/kg_a], 45 < psi < 90 [%],
..math::
y_f = 0.20*t*(Tf - Tp)**0.4
Tf : float
Frost Temperature [K]
Tp : float
Cold Plate Surface [K]
t : float
time [s]

y_f : Frost Thickness [m]

>>>

..[1] (insert here)

frostypy.thermal_conductivity module¶

  • Thermal Conductivity

Thermal Conductivity¶

frostypy.thermal_conductivity.Lee(rho_f)¶

Calculates the frost thermal conductivity, k_f, according to the Lee et. al correlation () for a flat plate, which is valid for: ???

Ta = 21 [C],

1.3 <= V < 5.3 [m/s], 7.5 <= w < 15 [g/kg_a], -30 <= Tp < -5 [C], 0 <= t < 200 [min]

..math::
k_f = 0.132 + 3.13*10^-4*rho_f + 1.6*10**-7 * rho_f**2
rho_f : float
Frost density [kg/m^3]

k_f : Frost Thermal Conductivity [J/kg*K]

>>>

..[1] K.S. Lee, T.H. Lee, W.S. Kim, Heat and Mass Transfer of parallel plate heat exchanger under frosting condition, Kor. J. Air-Cond. Refrig. Eng. 6(2) (1994) 155-165

frostypy.thermal_conductivity.Ostin(rho_f)¶

Calculates the frost thermal conductivity, k_f, according to the Ostin & Andersson correlation for parallel plates, which is valid for:

20 <= Ta <= 21 [C],
V = 3 [m/s],

4.6 <= w <= 10.50 [g/kg_a], -20 <= Tp <= -7 [C], 0 <= t <= 300 [min]

..math::
k_f = -8.71*10**-3 +4.39*10**-4 * rho_f + 1.05*10**-6*rho_f**2
rho_f : float
Frost density [kg/m^3]

k_f : Frost Thermal Conductivity [J/kg*K]

>>>

..[1] Ostin R, Anderson S. Frost growth parameters in a forced air stream. Int J Heat Mass Transfer 1991;14(4/5):1009-17

frostypy.thermal_conductivity.Yonko(rho_f)¶

Calculates the frost thermal conductivity, k_f, according to the Yonko & Sepsy correlation (1967) for a flat plate, which is valid for:

Ta = 21 [C],

1.3 <= V < 5.3 [m/s], 7.5 <= w < 15 [g/kg_a], -30 <= Tp < -5 [C], 0 <= t < 200 [min]

..math::
k_f = 0.014 + 0.00668*rho_f + 0.0001759*rho_f**2
rho_f : float
Frost density [kg/m^3]

k_f : Frost Thermal Conductivity [J/kg*K]

>>>

..[1] Yonko JD, Sepsy CF. An investigation of the thermal conductivity of frost while forming on a flat horizontal plate. ASHRAE Transactions 1967;73(2):1.1-1.11

frostypy.thermal_conductivity.Lee(rho_f)

Calculates the frost thermal conductivity, k_f, according to the Lee et. al correlation () for a flat plate, which is valid for: ???

Ta = 21 [C],

1.3 <= V < 5.3 [m/s], 7.5 <= w < 15 [g/kg_a], -30 <= Tp < -5 [C], 0 <= t < 200 [min]

..math::
k_f = 0.132 + 3.13*10^-4*rho_f + 1.6*10**-7 * rho_f**2
rho_f : float
Frost density [kg/m^3]

k_f : Frost Thermal Conductivity [J/kg*K]

>>>

..[1] K.S. Lee, T.H. Lee, W.S. Kim, Heat and Mass Transfer of parallel plate heat exchanger under frosting condition, Kor. J. Air-Cond. Refrig. Eng. 6(2) (1994) 155-165

frostypy.thermal_conductivity.Ostin(rho_f)

Calculates the frost thermal conductivity, k_f, according to the Ostin & Andersson correlation for parallel plates, which is valid for:

20 <= Ta <= 21 [C],
V = 3 [m/s],

4.6 <= w <= 10.50 [g/kg_a], -20 <= Tp <= -7 [C], 0 <= t <= 300 [min]

..math::
k_f = -8.71*10**-3 +4.39*10**-4 * rho_f + 1.05*10**-6*rho_f**2
rho_f : float
Frost density [kg/m^3]

k_f : Frost Thermal Conductivity [J/kg*K]

>>>

..[1] Ostin R, Anderson S. Frost growth parameters in a forced air stream. Int J Heat Mass Transfer 1991;14(4/5):1009-17

frostypy.thermal_conductivity.Yonko(rho_f)

Calculates the frost thermal conductivity, k_f, according to the Yonko & Sepsy correlation (1967) for a flat plate, which is valid for:

Ta = 21 [C],

1.3 <= V < 5.3 [m/s], 7.5 <= w < 15 [g/kg_a], -30 <= Tp < -5 [C], 0 <= t < 200 [min]

..math::
k_f = 0.014 + 0.00668*rho_f + 0.0001759*rho_f**2
rho_f : float
Frost density [kg/m^3]

k_f : Frost Thermal Conductivity [J/kg*K]

>>>

..[1] Yonko JD, Sepsy CF. An investigation of the thermal conductivity of frost while forming on a flat horizontal plate. ASHRAE Transactions 1967;73(2):1.1-1.11

frostypy.thickness module¶

  • Frost Thickness

Frost Thickness¶

frostypy.thickness.Cremers_free(Tf, Tp, t)¶

Calculates the frost thickness, z, according to the Cremers & Mehra correlation for a tube, which is valid for:

Ta = 24 [C] Free convection 9.2 <= w <= 15 [g/kg_a], 45 <= psi <= 90 [%],
..math::
y_f = 0.20*t*(Tf - Tp)**0.4
Tf : float
Frost Temperature [K]
Tp : float
Cold Plate Surface [K]
t : float
time [s]

y_f : Frost Thickness [m]

>>>

..[1] (insert here)

frostypy.thickness.Cremers(Tf, Tp, t)¶

Calculates the frost thickness according to the Cremers & Mehra correlation for a tube, which is valid for:

-90 <= Tp <= -60 [C], 0 <= t <= 600 [min], 34 <= psi <= 53 [%],
..math::
y_f = 0.12*t*(Tf - Tp)**0.43
Tf : float
Frost Temperature [K]
Tp : float
Cold Plate Surface [K]
t : float
time [s]

y_f : Frost Thickness [m]

>>>

..[1] Cremers CJ, Mehra VK. Frost formation on vertical cylinders in free convection. ASME Journal of Heat Transfer 1908;104(1):3-7

frostypy.thickness.Hermes_2012()¶

Calculates the frost thickness according to Hermes et. al (2012) correlation for a flat plate, which is valid for:

5.3 <= a1*(Ta-Tw) <= 8.5 [C] 0.0057 <= wa-ww <= 0.0090 [kg_v/kg_a]

Re <= 3*10^7 [-]

29.3 <= Nu <= 40.6 [-] 82 <= rho_f <= 318 [kg/m^3] 0 <= t <= 120 [min]

..math:

Ta : float
Air Temperature [C]
Tw : float
Plate Temperature [C]
Tm : float
Melting-point Temperature of water-ice [C]
Tf : float
Frost Temperature [C]
pv : float
Partial vapor pressure of the air [-]
psat : float
Vapor pressure of saturated air [%]
psatf : float
Vapor pressure of saturated air at the frost surface temperature [-]
kice : float
Ice thermal conductivity (kJ/kg*K)
pice : float
Ice density (kg/m^3)

isv : float

t : float
Time [s]

rho : Frost density [kg/m^3]

>>>

..[1] Hermes, C.J., 2012. An analytical solution to the problem of frost growth and densification on flat surfaces. Int. J. Heat Mass Transf. 55 (23-24), 7346-7351.

frostypy.thickness.Lee()¶

Calculates the frost thickness, z, according to the Lee (1997) correlation for a flat plate, which is valid for:

Tw = -15 [C], Ta = 25 [C],

50 <= RH <= 80 [%], 6000 <= Re <= 50000 [-], 50 <= rho_f <= 400 [kg/m^3], 0 <= t <= 120 [min]

..math:

Ta : float
Air Temperature [C]
Tw : float
Plate Temperature [C]
Tm : float
Melting-point Temperature of water-ice [C]
Tf : float
Frost Temperature [C]
pv : float
Partial vapor pressure of the air [-]
psat : float
Vapor pressure of saturated air [%]
psatf : float
Vapor pressure of saturated air at the frost surface temperature [-]
kice : float
Ice thermal conductivity (kJ/kg*K)
pice : float
Ice density (kg/m^3)

isv : float

t : float
Time [s]

rho : Frost density [kg/m^3]

>>>

..[1] Lee, K.-S., Kim, W.-S. Lee, T.-H., 1997. A one-dimensional model for frost formation on a cold surface. Int. J. Heat Mass Transf. 40, 4359-4365.

frostypy.thickness.Okoroafor(b0, b1, t, n)¶
frostypy.thickness.Schneider(Tf, Tm, Tw, k_i, hsub, rho_i, t, p, pfsat, psat)¶

Calculates the frost thickness, z, according to Schneider et. al (1978) correlation for a flat plate, which is valid for:

-30 <= Tw <= -5 [C], 5 <= Ta <= 15 [C], 96 <= RH <- 99 [%], 4000 <= Re <= 32000 [-], 60 <= t <= 480 [min]

..math:

Ta : float
Air Temperature [C]
Tw : float
Plate Temperature [C]
Tm : float
Melting-point Temperature of water-ice [C]
Tf : float
Frost Temperature [C]
pv : float
Partial vapor pressure of the air [-]
psat : float
Vapor pressure of saturated air [%]
psatf : float
Vapor pressure of saturated air at the frost surface temperature [-]
kice : float
Ice thermal conductivity (kJ/kg*K)
pice : float
Ice density (kg/m^3)

isv : float

t : float
Time [s]

z : Frost thickness [m]

>>>

..[1] Schneider, H.W., 1978. Equation of the growth rate of frost forming on cooled surfaces. Int. J. Heat Mass Trasnfer. 21 (8), 1019-1024.

frostypy.thickness.Sengupta(d, Re, Pr, w, Fo)¶

Calculates the frost thickness according to the Sengupta et al. correlation for a cylinder in cross-flow, which is valid for:

Ta = 29 [C]

1.5 <= V <= 4.4 [m/s] 10.0 <= w <= 20.0 [g/kg_a]

..math::
y_f = 0.84 * d * Re**-0.15 * Pr**0.65 * (1+w)**0.71 * Fo**0.11
d : float
cylinder diameter [m]
Re : float
Reynolds number [-]
Pr : float
Prandtl number [-]
w : float
Relative Humidity [%]
Fo : float
Fourier number [-]

y_f : Frost Thickness [m]

>>>

..[1] Segupta S, Sherif SA, Wong KV. Empirical heat transfer and frost thickness correlations during frost deposition on a cylinder in cross-flow in the transient regime. Int J Energy Research 1998;615-24.

frostypy.thickness.Yang(Re, Fo, w, Ta, Ttp, Tp, L)¶

Calculates the frost thickness according to the Yang et al. correlation for a flat plate, which is valid for:

Ta = 21 [C],

1.3 <= V < 5.3 [m/s], 7.5 <= w < 15 [g/kg_a], -30 <= Tp < -5 [C], 0 <= t < 200 [min]

..math::
y_f = 2.878 * (Re**0.193) * (Fo**0.573) * (w**1.738) * (T**-1.029)
Re : float
Reynolds number [-]
Fo : float
Fourier number [-]
w : float
Absolute humidity [kg_w/kg_air]
Ta : float
Air temperature [C]
Tp : float
Plate temperature [C]
Ttp : float
Triple point of water [C]
L : float
plate length [m]

y_f : Frost Thickness [m]

>>>

..[1] Yang, D.-K., Lee, K-S., 2004. Dimensionless correlations of frost properties on a cold plate. Int J. Refrigeration 27 (1), 89-96.

frostypy.thickness.Cremers_free(Tf, Tp, t)

Calculates the frost thickness, z, according to the Cremers & Mehra correlation for a tube, which is valid for:

Ta = 24 [C] Free convection 9.2 <= w <= 15 [g/kg_a], 45 <= psi <= 90 [%],
..math::
y_f = 0.20*t*(Tf - Tp)**0.4
Tf : float
Frost Temperature [K]
Tp : float
Cold Plate Surface [K]
t : float
time [s]

y_f : Frost Thickness [m]

>>>
